page.title: 03THE POPULATION OF PARR.
page.content: The population of the area is in the region of fifteen thousand people, over half of them under the age of thirty five years and only two thousand, approximately over the age of retirement. The death rate for the borough as a whole in 1983 was 11.8% whist the birth rate was 12.3%. Within the area of our study, almost seven thousand of the population were economically active, from a population of eleven and a half thousand over the age of 16 years. Five and a half thousand of these were in work, just over one thousand retired whilst thirteen hundred were seeking work. We calculated this to be a rate of 5.2%, but it is very striking to note that of a total of five and a half thousand women of working age, four thousand were economically inactive.
